abstract.p: Corrections of Aug 29 article: Lori Berenson did not raise fist to cameras when she appeared before journalists at Peruvian detention center in 1996; her lawyer now says she did not have romantic relationship with rebel; said rebel who testified against her may have done so to get lighter sentence, not life sentence

block.p: A front-page article on Tuesday about a decision by a Peruvian military court to revoke a life sentence and grant a new treason trial to Lori Berenson, a New Yorker,included an erroneous detail in an account of an appearance by Ms. Berenson before journalists at a detention center in 1996. She did not raise a fist to the cameras.

The article also included an outdated statement by one of her lawyers, Thomas Nooter. While he said four years ago that Ms. Berenson had had a romantic relationship with a member of the Tupac Amaru rebel group, Mr. Nooter now says that he knows from speaking to her since then that she did not.

The article also misstated what Mr. Nooter had said about a rebel who testified against Ms. Berenson. He said that the rebel might have incriminated her in exchange for a lighter sentence, not in exchange for a life sentence.
